title: Public-Facing Website for taskul.us
description: Build and launch the public website for Taskulus at taskul.us. Gatsby-based static site hosted on AWS Amplify Gen 2, with custom domain and Route 53 DNS. Reference structure: ~/Projects/VideoML/videoml-org

title: Create web app scaffold under apps/taskul.us
description: Scaffold a Gatsby site at apps/taskul.us following ~/Projects/VideoML/videoml-org. Agent MUST inspect that reference. Include Gatsby 5, React 18, TypeScript, Tailwind, Layout/Hero, placeholder pages, gatsby-config. Target Amplify Gen 2.
close_reason: Gatsby scaffold at apps/taskul.us complete. Gatsby 5, Tailwind, Layout/Hero, placeholder index. Deployed to Amplify.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Goal: scaffold Gatsby 5 + React 18 + TypeScript + Tailwind site under apps/taskul.us, following reference repo and target Amplify Gen 2.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Scaffolded Gatsby 5 site under apps/taskul.us with React 18, TypeScript, Tailwind, layout/hero, and placeholder pages (index, product, docs, roadmap). Added gatsby-config, gatsby-browser, postcss, tailwind, and tsconfig.

title: Design site content and structure
description: Design content strategy, IA, pages, sections, navigation for taskul.us. May include wireframes/outlines.

title: Author site content
description: Write copy and content for taskul.us: homepage, docs, marketing. Separate from design.

title: Provision and launch site on Amplify
description: Provision on Amplify Gen 2, configure Gatsby build, wire to repo, get site live.
close_reason: Amplify app d11ru5nyvcz6ac provisioned. Gatsby build fixed (gatsby-plugin-postcss). Site building and live. Launched with placeholder content; design/author tasks deferred.

title: Connect custom domain taskul.us to Amplify
description: Add custom domain to Amplify app, configure SSL. Assumes DNS delegated to Route 53.
close_reason: Custom domain taskul.us connected to Amplify. Root only, no www. SSL cert provisioning.

title: Set up DNS hosting for taskul.us
description: Create Route 53 hosted zone for taskul.us, get nameservers, document steps to add them in GoDaddy.
close_reason: Route 53 hosted zone for taskul.us created. Nameservers provided to user; GoDaddy updated. Zone Z07942121NHF0K1PMUZQM.

title: Workflow State Machine
description: Implement workflow status validation and state transitions. Includes state machine enforcement, transition side-effects, and per-type workflows.

title: Write Gherkin scenarios for workflow transitions
description: Scenarios for: valid transitions, invalid transitions with clear errors, per-type workflows, --claim workflow (assign + in_progress atomically), transition side-effects.

title: Implement workflows in Python
description: Implement workflows.py: validate_transition(), apply_side_effects(), get_current_user_from_git(). Load workflow from config, validate state machine.

title: Implement workflows in Rust
description: Implement workflows.rs with same logic. Test with shared scenario files.

title: Epic 3: Verify workflow parity
description: All scenarios pass in both implementations, error messages match, parity checker clean.

title: Data Models and Configuration
description: Implement core data structures (Issue, Config, Dependency, Comment) and configuration loading. Includes ID generation and JSON/YAML serialization with guaranteed parity between Python and Rust.

title: Write Gherkin scenarios for config loading and ID generation
description: Scenarios for: valid config.yaml parsing, invalid YAML handling, default values, custom prefix, SHA256 ID generation, collision handling.

title: Implement ID generation in Python
description: Implement ids.py with generate_id(title, timestamp, existing_ids). Use hashlib.sha256, handle collisions with retry, prefix support.

title: Implement ID generation in Rust
description: Implement ids.rs with sha2 crate. Must generate identical IDs to Python for same inputs. Test with shared fixtures.

title: Implement data models in Python
description: Implement models.py: IssueData, Config, Dependency, Comment dataclasses. JSON serialization with pretty-printing, RFC3339 timestamps, sorted keys.

title: Implement data models in Rust
description: Implement models.rs with serde. Ensure JSON output matches Python exactly: same key order, same timestamp format, same pretty-printing.

title: Create JSON serialization parity tests
description: YAML test cases that load the same Issue data in both implementations and verify byte-for-byte identical JSON output. Critical for file compatibility.

title: Epic 2: Verify data model parity
description: Run all scenarios, verify serialization parity tests pass, check quality gates.

title: Basic Index and File Scanning
description: Implement basic issue indexing capability to scan project/issues/ directory and build a by_id map. Required before CRUD operations can validate parent references.

title: Write Gherkin scenarios for basic index building
description: Scenarios for: scan issues directory, build by_id map, handle corrupted JSON, handle missing files, empty directory.

title: Implement basic index in Python
description: Implement index.py: scan_issues_directory(), build_by_id_map(). Simple in-memory dict, no caching yet.

title: Implement basic index in Rust
description: Implement index.rs: scan and build HashMap. Match Python behavior.

title: Epic 5: Verify index parity
description: All scenarios pass, both implementations produce same index structure.

title: Migration from Beads
description: Implement tsk migrate --from beads command to convert Beads JSONL format to Taskulus. Critical for user adoption. Includes migration guide documentation.

title: Research Beads JSONL format
description: Document Beads schema, field mappings to Taskulus, what gets lost. Design migration strategy.

title: Write Gherkin scenarios for migration
description: Scenarios for: parse Beads JSONL, map to Taskulus issues, handle field mismatches, validate migrated data.

title: Implement tsk migrate in Python
description: Implement migrate command: read .beads/*.jsonl, convert to project/issues/*.json, map status to workflows.

title: Implement tsk migrate in Rust
description: Implement migration in Rust matching Python.

title: Create test Beads repository for migration testing
description: Sample Beads repo with realistic data (50-100 issues, various types, dependencies). Test migration produces valid Taskulus project.

title: Write MIGRATION.md guide
description: Step-by-step guide: backup Beads, run migrate, validate, what's preserved vs. lost, troubleshooting.

title: Epic 14: Verify migration works
description: Successfully migrate test repo, all issues valid, no data loss in critical fields.

title: Polish and Quality Refinement
description: Final polish pass: error message consistency, performance testing, edge case coverage, Windows support if in scope.

title: Error message audit and consistency
description: Review all error messages across both implementations. Ensure consistent format, helpful guidance, consistent wording. Create error message catalog.

title: Performance regression tests
description: Add CI performance gates: benchmarks must not regress >10%. Test with 1000-issue fixture.

title: Edge case scenario review
description: Review all Gherkin scenarios for missing edge cases: concurrent writes, filesystem errors, corrupted data, race conditions. Add scenarios.

title: Windows support verification
description: If Windows is in scope: test on Windows, fix path issues, handle symlink alternative for feature files.

title: Final spec parity verification
description: Run parity checker, verify 100% coverage in both implementations, no drift.

title: Dogfooding: Use Taskulus to manage Taskulus
description: Migrate this planning work into Taskulus itself. Use it for remaining tasks. Surface any UX issues.

title: Epic 17: Ready for 1.0 release
description: All quality gates pass, all epics complete, documentation complete, tested on multiple platforms. Milestone 4 (M4).

title: Dependency Management
description: Implement dependency operations (blocked-by, relates-to), cycle detection, and ready query. Full dependency graph management.

title: Write Gherkin scenarios for dependencies
description: Scenarios for: add blocked-by, add relates-to, remove dependency, cycle detection with error, tsk ready query (issues with no open blockers).

title: Implement dependencies in Python
description: Implement dependencies.py: add/remove deps, build dependency graph, detect_cycles() with DFS, ready_query().

title: Implement dependencies in Rust
description: Implement dependencies.rs matching Python logic. Use petgraph or custom graph impl.

title: Epic 8: Verify dependency parity
description: All scenarios pass, cycle detection works, ready query correct.

title: Query and List Operations

title: Implement queries in Rust

description: All scenarios pass, search behavior consistent. Milestone 2 (M2).

title: Repository Bootstrap and Foundation
description:
Set up the repository structure, build configuration, CI pipeline, and quality gates for both Python and Rust implementations. This epic establishes the foundation for all future work.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Python and Rust build configurations working
- All quality gates (Ruff, Black, clippy, rustfmt) passing
- CI pipeline green
- Shared BDD feature file infrastructure ready
- Makefile with convenience targets

**Reference:** Planning documents in planning/IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: All Epic 0 tasks completed: repo bootstrap, specs scaffolding, CI pipeline, parity checker, and CI fixes. CI green.

title: Repository skeleton and build configuration
description:
Create the directory structure, build files, and dependency configuration for both Python and Rust implementations.

**Python deliverables:**
- pyproject.toml with dependencies: click, jinja2, pyyaml, pytest, pytest-bdd, ruff, black, sphinx, pytest-cov
- src/taskulus/__init__.py with version string
- Empty test suite that passes

**Rust deliverables:**
- Cargo.toml with dependencies: clap, serde, serde_json, serde_yaml, minijinja, sha2, cucumber, cargo-tarpaulin
- src/main.rs and src/lib.rs stubs
- Empty test suite that passes

**Quality gates:**
- ruff check python/ passes
- black --check python/ passes
- cargo clippy passes with no warnings  
- cargo fmt --check passes
- pytest passes (0 tests)
- cargo test passes (0 tests)

**Acceptance criteria:** All quality gates green, both implementations build successfully.

title: Set up CI pipeline and development Makefile
description:
Create the continuous integration pipeline and local development tooling.

**Deliverables:**
- .github/workflows/ci.yml running all quality gates on every push/PR
- Makefile with targets:
  - make check-python (ruff, black, pytest)
  - make check-rust (clippy, rustfmt, cargo test)  
  - make check-all (both)
  - make fmt (format both implementations)
  - make test (run all tests)
- .gitignore covering Python (__pycache__, .pytest_cache, .coverage), Rust (target/), and Taskulus (project/.cache/)
- tools/ directory for quality scripts

**Acceptance criteria:** CI passes on an empty PR, local make targets work.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter

title: Implement spec parity checking tool
description:
Create tools/check_spec_parity.py to verify both implementations cover the same Gherkin steps.

**Algorithm:**
1. Parse all .feature files in specs/features/
2. Extract all Given/When/Then steps (excluding @wip scenarios)
3. Parse Python step definitions in python/tests/step_definitions/
4. Parse Rust step definitions in rust/tests/step_definitions/
5. Report any steps defined in only one implementation
6. Exit with error code if parity is broken

**Acceptance criteria:** Tool runs successfully on empty step definition files, reports parity status, can be integrated into CI.

**Integration:** Add to Makefile as make check-parity and to CI pipeline.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Goal: implement tools/check_spec_parity.py to compare non-@wip feature steps against Python and Rust step definitions, add Makefile check-parity target and CI integration.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Added tools/check_spec_parity.py, created step_definitions dirs for Python and Rust, added Makefile check-parity target and wired into CI. Ran python tools/check_spec_parity.py successfully.

description: Fix CI failure where python/pyproject.toml readme path points outside package root. Ensure editable install succeeds in GitHub Actions.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Updated python/pyproject.toml readme path to README.md and added python/README.md to keep editable install within package root. make check-python passed.

title: Fix CI badge publishing
description: Fix CI badge publishing failure by generating badges in a separate job and deploying them to a badges branch. Ensure badges directory exists and remove unsupported inputs.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Reworked CI to generate badges in a dedicated job (needs python/rust), create badges directory, and publish to badges branch via peaceiris/actions-gh-pages. Removed unsupported badge-action inputs.

title: Fix CI badge URLs
description: Fix CI badges to use SVG output and update README badge URLs to raw SVG instead of shields endpoint.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Updated CI workflow to write SVG badges and README badge URLs to raw SVG files on badges branch.

title: Generate local coverage badges
description: Compute coverage in CI, generate local coverage badges (Python/Rust) without external services, and update README to use those badges.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Added tools/coverage_badge.py and updated CI to compute coverage percent/colors and publish local coverage badges; README now uses local badge SVGs. Coverage XML not present locally unless pytest --cov is run.

title: Clarify coverage badge labels
description: Update coverage badge labels to explicitly indicate Python and Rust.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Updated CI badge labels to 'python coverage' and 'rust coverage' for clarity.
